decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' hands with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, while utilizing aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure. It also includes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude to control the board. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and includes versatile lands like Castle Locthwain and Hive of the Eye Tyrant. By combining aggressive creatures with disruption and removal, the deck aims to out-value and out-tempo opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with specific abilities to create a powerful combination that can disrupt the opponent and generate value. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, the deck can search for and sacrifice creatures to control the board and drain the opponent's life total. The toolbox aspect allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups, while the combo potential with cards like Walking Ballista and Blood Artist can provide a win condition. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and synergistic creature-based strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a variety of powerful spells and creatures. It utilizes the element of surprise with the companion card Kaheera, the Orphanguard, and has a strong mana base to support its four-color control strategy. The deck includes versatile removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Wrenn and Six. The One Ring and Cosmic Rebirth provide additional ways to control the game and outvalue opponents. Supreme Verdict offers a board wipe option, while Leyline Binding helps to lock down key threats.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, using low-cost spells and prowess triggers to deal damage to the opponent efficiently. It also includes cards that can return important spells from the graveyard, allowing for powerful combos and increased consistency. The land base is designed to support the deck's speed and color requirements. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent while quickly building up damage output through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

The deck focuses on efficiently putting big threats into play using graveyard recursion and instant speed interactions. By utilizing cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate, the deck can quickly reanimate creatures like Griselbrand or Atraxa, Grand Unifier to gain a significant advantage. The combination of disruptive creatures like Grief and Solitude, along with instant speed removal and card draw, allows the deck to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a powerful combo finish. The deck aims to out-value and out-tempo the opponent with its strong synergy and versatile playstyle.

The main focus of this aggressive Jund deck is to maintain pressure on the opponent by utilizing efficient removal spells and disrupt their hand with discard spells. The deck aims to control the board with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer while generating value through cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Wrenn and Six. The inclusion of Urza's Saga allows for versatile tutor options to find key cards like Shadowspear or equipment. The deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures and benefiting from tribal synergies with lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Merfolk Trickster and Tide Shaper while also providing some control options with Tishana's Tidebinder and Dismember. Aether Vial is used for mana acceleration and flexibility, allowing for instant creature deployment. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a fast, efficient Merfolk tribal strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, while utilizing efficient removal spells like Fatal Push to control the board. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger to apply pressure on the opponent. Magus of the Moon helps to punish non-basic lands, while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse acts as a powerful finisher. The deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive strategy, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor to generate explosive mana ramp and combo off with Primeval Titan to search for key lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The One Ring. Dryad of the Ilysian Grove helps fix mana and enables powerful land combos. The deck aims to quickly assemble its lands and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with massive damage and board presence. It also utilizes Urza's Saga to find key artifacts and generate additional value. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble its combo pieces and outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly bringing out powerful creatures with Cascade abilities to overwhelm the opponent. By leveraging cards like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst, the deck aims to cascade into spells like Crashing Footfalls and Lórien Revealed to create a strong board presence. The inclusion of counter spells like Force of Negation helps protect the strategy while cards like Murktide Regent and Tishana's Tidebinder provide additional threats. The deck also includes versatile spells like Subtlety and Fire / Ice to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that work together to create powerful combo plays. By utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the deck can quickly access the creatures it needs to generate value and outmaneuver opponents. The key strategy revolves around using various synergies between creatures such as Gilded Goose, Chatterfang, Squirrel General, and Academy Manufactor to create a powerful engine that can overwhelm opponents with a combination of token generation, sacrifice effects, and value generation.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful equipment combo to quickly and efficiently take down opponents. By using cards like Stoneforge Mystic, Puresteel Paladin, and Esper Sentinel to search for and equip Colossus Hammer, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage in just a few turns. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps find the necessary pieces quickly, while cards like Meddling Mage and Spellskite provide protection and disruption. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a fast and deadly combination of creatures and equipment.

This deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters to strengthen creatures and create powerful synergies. It relies on Hardened Scales to effectively double the number of counters placed on creatures, making them larger and more threatening. The deck includes a mix of creatures with modular abilities, such as Walking Ballista and Arcbound Ravager, along with support cards like Zabaz, the Glimmerwasp and The Ozolith to ensure the counters are not wasted. Agatha's Soul Cauldron provides a potential win condition by sacrificing creatures with counters on them to deal damage to the opponent.

The deck aims to quickly cycle through cards to fill up the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. By using cards like Curator of Mysteries, Street Wraith, and Shardless Agent to cycle through the deck, the player can set up powerful combos with cards like Generous Ent and Oliphaunt. This deck relies on efficient graveyard manipulation and explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

This deck aims to manipulate the graveyard by cycling creatures and using cascade spells to cheat out powerful creatures like Oliphaunt and Generous Ent. By cycling through the deck quickly, the player can set up for a game-winning Living End to return all creatures from the graveyard to the battlefield. The inclusion of disruption like Force of Negation allows the player to protect their combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base supports the necessary colors for the deck's spells and includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures for protection.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and tempo of the game with fast, efficient spells and creatures. By utilizing disruptive elements like countermagic and removal spells, as well as powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to quickly apply pressure and hinder the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of card draw and manipulation helps ensure a consistent flow of threats and answers, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive game plan while denying the opponent opportunities to stabilize or gain momentum.
